snippet: Rather than dismantling George W. Bush’s approach to guarding national security, President Obama has to some extent validated it and put it on a more sustainable footing.
abstract: Disclosure of government's surveillance of American telephone records and foreigners' Internet communications serves as potent reminder that Pres Obama continues to deploy many of the national security tools he inherited from his predecessor Pres George W Bush, even as he seeks to turn the corner in the way the United States responds to terrorism.
lead_paragraph: Rather than dismantling George W. Bush’s approach to guarding national security, President Obama has to some extent validated it and put it on a more sustainable footing.

headline.seo: Obama’s Strong Embrace of Divisive Security Tools
headline.main:
Even as Wars Fade,
Obama Maintains
Bush’s Data Mining
headline.print_headline: Despite Ambivalence, a Strong Embrace of Divisive Security Tools
